overview.about: Budapest is the capital and most populous city of Hungary. It is the ninth-largest city in the European Union by population within city limits and the second-largest city on the Danube river; the city has an estimated population of 1,752,286 over a land area of about 525 square kilometers (203 square miles). Budapest, which is both a city and county, forms the center of the Budapest metropolitan area, which has an area of 7,626 square kilometers (2,944 square miles) and a population of 3,303,786; it is a primate city, constituting 33% of the population of Hungary.

extra_activities.title: Visit St. Stephen's Basilica
extra_activities.description: This stunning Catholic cathedral is one of the city's most iconic landmarks.

extra_activities.title: Explore the Jewish Quarter
extra_activities.description: This neighborhood is home to several important Jewish sites, including the Dohány Street Synagogue, the largest synagogue in Europe.

extra_activities.title: Take a cruise on the Danube River
extra_activities.description: This is a great way to see the city's landmarks from a different perspective, including the Parliament Building and the Chain Bridge.

extra_activities.title: Visit Buda Castle
extra_activities.description: This historic castle complex offers stunning views of the city and is home to several museums and galleries.

events.hover_info: You arrived at Aeropuerto de Budapest-Ferenc Liszt (Budapest Airport)
You must go to Corinthia Budapest at Erzsébet krt. 43-49, 1073
Széchenyi Spa Full Day with Optional Pálinka Tour

activity_data.activity_name: Széchenyi Spa Full Day with Optional Pálinka Tour
activity_data.description: The Széchenyi Medicinal Bath in Budapest is the largest medicinal bath in Budapest. Its water is supplied by two thermal springs, their temperature is 74 °C and 77 °C. Components of the thermal water include sulfate, calcium, magnesium, bicarbonate and a significant amount of metaboric acid and fluoride.

events.hover_info: You will go to Budapest Nepliget bus station.

sections.title: BANKING AND CURRENCY
sections.information: In Hungary you will use Euro.
